intro: Oreobroma tweedyi, commonly known as the Tweedy's oreobroma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in woodland and wetland habitats. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Oreobroma tweedyi is often found in areas with high humidity and is an important part of the local flora in its native range.
